PW-PC (Council on Aging) -- 7-1/2 Mills - Parish Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Council on Aging Renewal)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 7-1/2 mills property tax for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, operating and maintaining capital improvements to serve the elderly; and for operating and maintaining programs for the elderly and disabled persons in Terrebonne Parish through the Terrebonne Council on Aging Incorporated.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of seven and one-half (7-1/2) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $4,475,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, operating and maintaining capital improvements to serve the elderly; and for operating and maintaining programs for the elderly and disabled persons in Terrebonne Parish through the Terrebonne Council on Aging Incorporated?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-PC (Mental Health) -- .42 Mills - Parish Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Mental Health Renewal)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year .42 mills property tax for operating and maintaining the Terrebonne Regional Mental Health Center.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of forty-two hundredths (.42) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $250,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of operating and maintaining the Terrebonne Regional Mental Health Center?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-PC (Health Unit) -- 1.66 Mills - Parish Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Parish Health Unit Renewal)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 1.66 mills property tax for operating and maintaining the Terrebonne Parish Health Unit.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of one and sixty-six hundredths (1.66) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $990,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of operating and maintaining the Terrebonne Parish Health Unit?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW-PC (Recreaton) -- 2.21 Mills - Parish Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Recreation Renewal)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 2.21 mills property tax for constructing, maintaining and operating recreation facilities and providing recreation programs in the Parish.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of two and twenty-one hundredths (2.21) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $1,300,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and operating recreation facilities and providing recreation programs in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#1 -- Prop.#1 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 1

Summary:  Amendment to Section 2-07. Council meetings and rules to amend Sections 2-07(c) and 2-07(d) of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter to provide that council proceedings shall be made available to the public in accordance with state law.
Race.FullText:
Shall Sections 2-07(c) and 2-07(d) of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows: 
(c) The council shall determine by resolution its own rules and order of business and shall provide for keeping a journal of its minutes and proceedings. This journal shall be a public record. All official actions of the council shall be made available to the public in accordance with state law. 
(d) At all regular meetings of the council, the council shall operate from an agenda which shall be made available to the public in accordance with state law, at least two (2) days prior to the meeting. The agenda for special or emergency meetings shall be made available to the public as soon as practical prior to the meeting?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#2 -- Prop.#2 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 2

Summary:  Amendment to Section 2-11 Action Requiring an Ordinance to require the Council to adopt an ordinance in order to authorize the levy of development impact fees.
Race.FullText:
Shall Section 2-11(19) be added to the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter to read as follows: 
(19) Authorize the levy of development impact fees?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#3 -- Prop.#3 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 3

Summary:  Amendment to Section 2-12 Ordinances in General to amend Section 2-12(b) to require proposed ordinances be read by title when introduced and published in full, in summary, or by title, within five days after introduction.
Race.FullText:
Shall Section 2-12(b) of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows:  
b) All proposed ordinances shall be read by title when introduced and published in full, in summary, or by title within five (5) days after introduction. Except as otherwise provided in Section 2-14 (Emergency Ordinances), no ordinance shall be considered for final passage until it has laid over at least two (2) weeks from the date of introduction and a public hearing has been held on the ordinance?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#4 -- Prop.#4 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 4

Summary:  Amendment to Section 5-08 Bonded Debt to authorize the
Parish Government to incur debt and issue bonds in accordance with the
charter and state law; to provide that expenditures of bond proceeds must be
included within the capital budget; and ratifying previous authorizations.
Race.FullText:
Shall Section 5.08 of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows: 
The Parish Government is empowered to incur bonded debt in accordance
with this charter and the constitution and laws of the state. No proceeds of any bond issue may be expended without specific inclusion in the capital budget. All bond authorizations previously authorized are hereby ratified and afforded?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#5 -- Prop.#5 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 5

Summary:  Amendment to Section 5-11 Emergency Fund Account to
amend the first paragraph of Section 5-11 that every 2 years the cap of
$1,500,000 will be increased by increments of $250,000 to a maximum cap
of $5,000,0000, which cap may be increased by a 2/3 vote of the Council.
Race.FullText:
Shall the first paragraph of Section 5-11 of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows:
Each year there shall be a minimum appropriation of $200,000, or 3% of General Fund revenues based on the previous year final audited revenues, whichever amount is greater, dedicated to an emergency fund account. All funds so appropriated and any interest accruing thereon shall be placed in this dedicated fund and shall be subject to the provisions of this section. In the event the fund has a balance of at least $1,500,000, the appropriation mandated herein shall become discretionary for all such periods of time that the fund has a balance of at least $1,500,000. Every two (2) years the cap of $1,500,000 will be increased by increments of $250,000 to a maximum cap of $5,000,000, which cap may be increased by a 2/3 vote of the Council?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#6 -- Prop.#6 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 6

Summary:  Amendment to Section 6-01 Initiative and Referendum to amend Sections 
6-01(2) and 6-01(3) to require 90 days in which the form of petition shall have been specified, the person or persons circulating the petition shall obtain the signatures of at least 15% of the total registered voters of the Parish and in which the signed petition shall be filed with the Council within the specification of the form of the petition.
Race.FullText:
Shall Sections 6-01(2) and 6-01(3) of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows:
(2) Within ninety (90) days after the form of the petition shall have been specified, the person or persons circulating the petition shall obtain the signatures of at least fifteen (15) percent of the total registered voters of the Parish. There shall be noted after each signature on the petition the date signed and the address of the signer. Each person circulating a copy of the petition shall attach a sworn affidavit to it stating the number of signers and the fact that each signature was made in the presence of the circulator of the petition.
(3) The signed petition shall be filed with the Council within ninety (90) days of the specification of the form of the petition and, upon filing, the Council shall order a canvass of the signatures through the office of the Parish Registrar of Voters to determine their sufficiency and authenticity. The Council's canvass shall be completed within thirty (30) days. If the number of signatures is insufficient or the petition is deficient as to form or compliance with this section, the Council shall notify the person or persons filing the petition of such sufficiency or deficiency and allow thirty (30) days for filing of additional papers, at the end of which time the sufficiency and correctness of the petition shall be determined finally?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#7 -- Prop.#7 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 7

Summary:  Amendment to Section 6-02 Recall to amend Section 6-02(a) to provide that elected officials of the Parish Government may be recalled in accordance with the procedures in state law.
Race.FullText:
Shall Section 6-02(a) of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows:
(a) Any elected official of the Parish Government may be removed from office by the electors of the Parish through a recall process. The recall procedure shall be the same as provided in the general laws of the state?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW- HRC#8 -- Prop.#8 - PC - HRC Amendment
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 8

Summary:  Amendment to Section 8-11 Election of officials to amend
Section 8-11(a) that the persons elected are to take office at noon on the
Thursday following the first Monday in January after their election.
Race.FullText:
Shall Section 8-11(a) of the Terrebonne Parish Home Rule Charter be amended to read as follows:
(a) The first election of the officials provided for by the charter shall coincide with the 1983 elections for governor, and subsequent elections shall be held on corresponding dates every fourth year thereafter. Persons elected under the provisions of this charter shall take office at noon on the Thursday following the first Monday in January after their election?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting Dist. No. 1 -- 6-1/2 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 1 Proposition
(Millage Renewal) 

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 6-1/2 mills property tax for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places within and for said District.
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 1 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of six and one-half (6-1/2) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $340,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting Dist. No. 5 -- 6-1/2 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 5 Proposition
(Millage Renewal) 

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 6-1/2 mills property tax for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places within and for said District.
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 5 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of six and one-half (6-1/2) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $100,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places within and for said District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 8 -- 10.52 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 8 Proposition
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10-year 10.52 mills property tax for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of ten and fifty-two hundredths (10.52) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $305,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Recreation District No. 9 -- 15 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Recreation District No. 9 Proposition
(Millage) 

Summary:  Authority for Recreation District No. 9 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana, to levy a 10 year 15-mills tax for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating recreation facilities in said District, including the purchase of equipment therefor, said tax to be in lieu of the similar 10 mills tax authorized at a special election held on July 21, 2001.
Race.FullText: Shall Recreation District No. 9 of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect a special tax of fifteen (15) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $598,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating recreation facilities in said District, including the purchase of equipment therefor, said tax to be in lieu of the similar 10 mills tax authorized at a special election held on July 21, 2001?
